main event: Saucer shaped illuminous [sic] object traveling at high speed, making a sound described as 'a mellow motor or engine sound and had a flat top, with a spherical bottom, emitting a light which changed from yellow to blue-green to amber to orange color,'
interesting points: The object had a formation of stationary 'scintillating' luminous objects for 30 seconds, then the bottom portion appeared to descend to diminish in size.

A colonel employed as an aircraft observer for the Industrial Division, Diamond Ordnance Fuze Laboratories, Adelphi, Maryland, observed a silver-colored, winglike object maneuvering at a very high speed, about the size of a jet fighter, and maintaining an altitude of approximately one hundred and fifty (150) feet, veering to the right and left as it flew.
The object appeared to climb at a 45 degree angle and attained a velocity in excess of 700 mph, and seemed to be controlled, changing direction and altitude abruptly.

The object had a spherical bottom and remained apparently not moving, in the above-described shape and position, for approximately (33) seconds. It seemed to shine with a bright metallic glisten and to show no signs of blinking lights.
The observer was an amateur 'ufologist' for approximately one year until 1952, and this was the first time he had ever observed a UFO.
witnesses: Civilian, Colonel employed as an aircraft observer
